snippet: Gov. Bill Haslam proposed using federal funds to cover 200,000 low-income residents through their employer’s health insurance plan or the state’s Medicaid program.
abstract: Tennessee Gov Bill Haslam proposes using federal Medicaid money to cover 200,000 low-income residents through their employer's health insurance plan or state's Medicaid program; move comes after increasing pressure from financially stressed hospitals.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Bill Haslam proposed using federal funds to cover 200,000 low-income residents through their employer’s health insurance plan or the state’s Medicaid program.

headline.main: With Hospitals Under Stress, Tennessee’s Governor Pursues Medicaid Expansion
headline.print_headline: With Hospitals Under Stress, Tennessee’s Governor Pursues Medicaid Expansion

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
